net.canarymod.api.world

Interface Biome


  • public interface Biome
    Biome contains data about a certain BiomeType
    Author:
    Chris (damagefilter)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canRain()
      Gets whether or not Rain is permitted
      boolean canSnow()
      Gets whether or not snow is permitted.
      boolean canSpawnLightning()
      Check if this biome can spawn lightning bolts.
      void decorate(World world, java.util.Random rnd, int x, int z)
      Decorates the chunk coordinates in the given world with decorations of this biome generator
      BiomeType getBiomeType()
      get the BiomeType for this BiomeGen
      int getRainfall()
      get an integer representing the amount of rainfall in this biome
      float getSpawnChance()
      Returns the chance a create can spawn here.
      float getTemperature()
      Returns a float value representing this biomes temperature
      boolean isTropic()
      Check if this is a tropic biome by determining the amount of rainfall.
      void setCanRain(boolean canRain)
      Sets whether or not Rain is permitted
      void setCanSnow(boolean canSnow)
      Sets whether or not snow is permitted.
      void setColor(java.lang.String hexColor)
      Sets the color of this biome.
      void setTemperatureAndPrecipitation(float temp, float precipitation)
      Sets the temperature for the biome, and the precipitation amount.
      NOTE: Please avoid temperatures in the range 0.1 - 0.2 because of snow.
      Temperatures less than .1 for snow; and temperatures greater than .2 for rain are preferred.
      All values here should be between 0.0F and 1.0F

    • Method Detail

      • canSpawnLightning

        boolean canSpawnLightning()
        Check if this biome can spawn lightning bolts.
        Returns:
        true is spawns lightning; false if not

      • isTropic

        boolean isTropic()
        Check if this is a tropic biome by determining the amount of rainfall. More rainfall means more tropic biome
        Returns:
        true is tropic; false if not

      • getSpawnChance

        float getSpawnChance()
        Returns the chance a create can spawn here. This is on a scale from 0 to 1
        Returns:
        spawn chance

      • getRainfall

        int getRainfall()
        get an integer representing the amount of rainfall in this biome
        Returns:
        rainfall

      • getTemperature

        float getTemperature()
        Returns a float value representing this biomes temperature
        Returns:
        temperature

      • decorate

        void decorate(World world,
              java.util.Random rnd,
              int x,
              int z)
        Decorates the chunk coordinates in the given world with decorations of this biome generator
        Parameters:
        world - the world
        rnd - the random
        x - the chunk x coordinate
        z - the chunk z coordinate

      • getBiomeType

        BiomeType getBiomeType()
        get the BiomeType for this BiomeGen
        Returns:
        BiomeType

      • setTemperatureAndPrecipitation

        void setTemperatureAndPrecipitation(float temp,
                                    float precipitation)
        Sets the temperature for the biome, and the precipitation amount.
        NOTE: Please avoid temperatures in the range 0.1 - 0.2 because of snow.
        Temperatures less than .1 for snow; and temperatures greater than .2 for rain are preferred.
        All values here should be between 0.0F and 1.0F
        Parameters:
        temp - temperature value.
        precipitation - precipitation value

      • setCanSnow

        void setCanSnow(boolean canSnow)
        Sets whether or not snow is permitted.
        Parameters:
        canSnow - whether or not it can snow.

      • setCanRain

        void setCanRain(boolean canRain)
        Sets whether or not Rain is permitted
        Parameters:
        canRain - make it rain.

      • canSnow

        boolean canSnow()
        Gets whether or not snow is permitted.
        Returns:
        true if snow is permitted.

      • canRain

        boolean canRain()
        Gets whether or not Rain is permitted
        Returns:
        true if rein is permitted.

      • setColor

        void setColor(java.lang.String hexColor)
        Sets the color of this biome.
        Parameters:
        hexColor - The hex code for this color.
